body: I think a rename might be a good idea in order to assist users. Additionally, the advantage you describe when using Cake or other build  systems would accrue to our users. It would not be an advantage for us, because we generally test using our latest console build, which can have options that the build system knows nothing about. That's why we never used the NAnt or MsBuild tasks that run NUnit.
Does anyone have a preference on the new name? Personally, I lean towards `nunit.exe` or `nunit3.exe` - less typing and a clear break :smile:

nunit.exe is the traditional name for the gui and I´d like to reserve
nunit3.exe for that purpose.

I always wanted to use nc.exe but that overlapped both netcat and norton
commander.

What are other folks using for their test framework consoles?

We could always go with nunit3-console of course.

Charlie

On Sun, Oct 25, 2015 at 1:48 PM, Rob Prouse notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Does anyone have a preference on the new name? Personally, I lean towards
> nunit.exe or nunit3.exe - less typing and a clear break [image: :smile:]
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/nunit/nunit/issues/929#issuecomment-150967629.

- xUnit uses `xunit.console.exe`
- MbUnit uses `gallio.echo.exe` for the console runner and `gallio.icarus.exe` for the GUI runner.
- MSTest uses `MSTest.exe`
- csUnit used `csUnitCmd.exe` :-1: 
- SpecFlow uses `runtests.cmd`

`nunit3-console` is ok by me. I would prefer something shorter like `nunit3` since you tend to run the GUI from a shortcut, but type the console runner. `nunit3-gui`?

I am going to move this to the RC unless anyone has objections. It should be quick to knock off once we decide on a name.

issue.title: Rename console to nunit3-console.exe - Fixes #929
issue.body:
I disliked `nunit-cmd.exe` because I thought it might be confused with `nunit.cmd` in documentation, so I went with your earlier suggestion of `nunit3-console`.

Everything builds, all tests run and everything packages.

issue.title: Re-Rename nunit-console runner?

labels.name: pri:critical
labels.description: Use this to indicate a hotfix may be necessary

milestone.title: Closed Without Action
milestone.description: This milestone contains closed issues where no action was taken. This includes questions, issues that could not be reproduced, rejected ideas, invalid issues, etc.

issue.body:
In resolving issue #929 we renamed nunit-console to nunit3-console. We did it pretty fast and not everyone is 100% happy. We have had some discussion but it's still hanging.

I'm creating this issue to force us to make a decision about the name before RC2, which is due out in a few days. I don't want to make the change past RC2, so a decision is critical.

Pros  and Cons of the original rename: (Feel free to edit this comment with more of them)

PRO 
It's a different program, with differnet options, let's give it a different name.
It will help some tools.
We have renamed some nuget packages, so we should rename the exe.

CON
Command-line users are used to typing nunit-console and know how to set the path.
It will hurt some tools.
We have renamed some nuget packages, so that should be sufficient.
We have not renamed other things, like nunitlite or the framework.

If I were doing this for me, based on personal preference, I'd revoke the change. We know that @NikolayPianikov was bothered by it. Feel free to include personal preferences.

If you don't care, I'm taking that as an indication we should not have changed it.
